Package Engine.enginePackage Description

Provides the implementation of the server and the engine.

Class Janus is the server implementation. Class Engine is the engine implementation.

Server

The server handles sessions for playing a storyworld and rehearsals. For each session it creates the engine instance that will interact with storyteller or rehearsal lizard.

The server has some defenses against denial of service attacks. This are explained further in the Janus documentation and JeriCustomServerSetup.

Engine

The Engine works over a storyworld model executing the reaction cycle. This involves sending and receiving data from the storyteller. The interactions are encapsulated through the interface EnginePlayerIO.

The class StorytellerPlayerIO implements EnginePlayerIO to provide the communication with storyteller.

The class ResumerIO implements EnginePlayerIO to play the story with a predefined input, most likely recorded during a previous session, and then handles control to another EnginePlayerIO instance (e.g. returns control to a StorytellerPlayerIO).

The class PlayerInputRecorder implements EnginePlayerIO to play recorded input. The main difference with ResumerIO is that the input may not be known a priori, and new input can be defined while playing input defined earlier. This class is used exclusively for rerunning a part of a story by LogDataCollector.

The engine is monitored through the class EngineLogger. This class has methods invoked by the engine to report execution of different parts of the reaction cycle. Thus EngineLogger can pick which data to collect during a given run of the engine.

When collecting detailed log data, the EngineLogger is fed by the LogDataCollector with request of specific portions of log data.
